title: [Large-scale] Social Science Simulation Design Using Object-Based Inquiry Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational social science theory and data analysis methods comprehension
context.additional_context: Project-based course for exploring and analyzing social science phenomena in a VR simulation environment using learners' personal devices

learning_goals: Learners model two social science phenomena (e.g., 'urban traffic congestion' or 'epidemic spread') using object-based microworld tools like NetLogo or StarLogo, and write a report analyzing causal relationships and feedback loops based on system diagrams and simulation results.
Learners enhance their ability to systematically analyze complex social issues using intelligent guidance strategies
Learners write policy proposals based on simulation results using operation-based decision trees
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
